text: At first only darkness, then the rising sun paints in an endless savanna from horizon to horizon. We hear savage d beating in the distance coming from some unknown place. The sun clears the horizon. Suddenly it changes amazingly the white disc goes through a rapid series of color transitions, from yellow to green to purple to an incredi BLOOD RED. From it shoots a RED LIGHTNING BOLT. The sky echoes with THUNDER. We hear a HOWLING ethereal wind, but not a twig of the br stirs as bolt after bolt of RED LIGHTNING rips the sky, w each one a TITLE or CREDIT appearing. Under FINAL CREDIT snow is beginning to fall on the burni blood-red savanna.
I's a Twin Otter with the logo of some commuter airline. buzzes along over pleasant countryside, through a sky tha almost unnaturally serene and filled with fleecy white cl

There are just two passengers in the cabin. One is DALE A a great looking dark-haired girl sitting by herself and reading a book entitled "KARATE FOR THE SINGLE GIRL.... A Guide to Survival In The City." A few rows forward, near open door into the pilots' compartment, is FLASH GORDON. He's studying a football play-sheet, one of those diagram things with X's and 0's for the players and dotted-line a indicating the directions of movement. Suddenly the plane makes a violent bump. It almost knocks the book from DALE'S hand. She looks out the window with sudden fright, tossing hair out of her eyes, in a gesture that's habitual to her in moments of stress. There's nothing to see outside but the pretty clouds. She looks forward again and watches FLASH standing up easily, leaning in t..e cockpit doorway to speak to the PILOTS.
(CO-P:ILOT, DALE, FLASH, PILOT)
What was that, fellas? 2.
Clear-air turbulence, is all. Nothing
But nothing you'd want to toss a third-down pass through either -- (Grinning back at
Can I have an autograph for my kid, Mr. Gordon?
Sure -- my pleasure. As FLASH takes a bit of paper from the CO-PILOT, the plan takes another jolt, even more violent than the first.
Wow. Call Westchester Approach, see what they've got.
I sure hope we don't have to turn back. I mean this is first day of training camp, I wouldn't want to be
Seat-belt time. FLASH starts back to his seat. The plane jumps again, shu violently. He holds on, calls up front:
Maybe it'd be smoother if you went
Will you SHUT UP? (as FLASH's head
Look, Mister Flash Gordon, they have their hands full -- just let 'em drive.
(DALE, FLASH)
The plane buffets. FLASH is sent reeling, catches hold of the rack above DALE, lowers himself into the seat next to her. He buckles fast, takes out a candy bar and offers it to her. 3.
When you're nervous, it can help to chew on something
Thanks a lot -- I look dumb enough to take candy from a stranger?
I'm not a stranger exactly -- You know my name.
Who doesn't. Number one draft pick, cover of PEOPLE mag -- what'd the GIANTS sign you for, eighty-nine million? Big deal!
Of course.

God, I hate flying -- I'm Dale Arden it's crazy of me to hate flying -- I'm a travel agent, you see? -- I've just been checking out a little hotel in Vermont -- can I still have that candy bar? (and in the same breath) Are we going backward?
Backwards?
Holy cow! Look at the clouds!

The pretty white clouds are changing above and beginning surround the airplane. Over the engines we HEAR that same ethereal wind rising which we heard in the opening. Slowl and terrifyingly, the sun starts turning BLOOD RED. The c race faster, faster, until they are actually streaming pa the plane from behind.
FLASH and DALE -- faces bathed in the eerie light. Speech DALE grasps the football player's hand with all her stren

It is a huge and rambling, antique, standing in semiruino isolation in a pretty country landscape. The sun has turn 4. the SAME BLOOD RED we saw from the airplane, and clouds r across it with unnatural velocity. In the center of the greenhouse rises a glass-paned tower through which we glimpse something MIRROR BRIGHT. Floatin high in the air above the structure are several silvery h filled balloons, secured by wires. As we move closer, we discern a MAN moving about actively on a platform inside central tower, about half-way up:
(MUNSON, TV NEWSMAN, ZARKOV)

The man is DR. HANS ZARKOV: big, bearded, feverish lookin and seemingly half mad with exhaustion. In striking contr to the antique greenhouse exterior, here there are all ki of computers and displays connected together in a slapdas fashion. Quantities of neglected plants, most brown and dead or dying, hide the works in here from outside view. Zarkov runs around throwing switches and eyeing displays, grim-voiced TV. NEWSMAN is appearing and speaking from a good-sized television screen above the main control conso

The extraordinary weather disturbances reported from Africa this morning are now crossing the Atlantic, and are expected to reach the East Coast of the United States by noon. According to scientists at NASA, the Earth is being struck by an immense stream of cosmic energy, apparently the result of some catastrophic stellar accident beyond the reaches
ZARKOV whirls, slams the TV SOUND OFF and yells at the silently mouthing NEWSMAN on the screen.
Fools! Can't you understand? This is no accident-- it's an ATTACK! An attack planned by a MIND! This is
MUNSON, a scared looking assistant, comes running up the stairs with a computer print-out sheet.
Dr. Zarkov! Look at the report from the last balloon! ZARKOV grabs it, eyes it. 5.
I predicted it, didn't I?
Yes, sir -- you sure did. And this funny sun too ---
Ozone layer starting to crack up. By tonight Carbon dioxide will be combining with free nitrogen to form -- (breaks off, crumpling
Well, this is it.
Sir, the President is on the TV behind
What the hell do I care? I tried to warn him -- he called me mad, like all the others. BOOM! The TV screen EXPLODES in a fine shower of glass.
Time for us to go, Munson. Get your toothbrush and whatever.
Go where?
Up. Up and at him. Stunned, MUNSON turns his head and glances at something b and MIRROR BRIGHT gleaming behind foliage in center of to
You're crazy! Perfectly calm except for the maniacal glint in his eyes, ZARKOV pulls out a revolver and points it at MUNSON.
I can't handle the capsule alone get your toothbrush.
(CO-PILOT, PILOT)
The PILOTS watch these clouds also, transfixed with disbe They speak with that incredible calmness characteristic o professional airmen in a moment of impending catastrophe. 6.
What's ,e word from Westchester Approach, Bill?

Zip. All chanels dead. (Reacting to the panel) Say, get a load of the VOR's.... The directional needles are going crazy. All the instrume are going crazy. Displays flash impossible symbols. The PILOT gapes at them a moment, then returns his gaze to th sky and swallows.

On the left, about six o'clock high...... The racing stream of clouds is parting open like in some surreal painting. From the cortex LASER-like bolts of RED LIGHTNING shoot out. Like a missile, one zaps right over plane's nose with a horrible crackling NOISE.

Hold on tight, let's put baby down right here...... The CO-PILOT reaches up and hits the flap control. There a whooshing crackling ZAP! The whole cockpit FLARES OUT with an intolerable blinding flash of RED LIGHT.
The cockpit door flys off its hinges, admitting a gale of wind that scatters FLASH'S play sheets like autumn leaves FLASH unsnaps his belt, leaps up and races forward.
(DALE, FLASH)

The TWO PILOTS are gone, vanished without trace. Wind fro the shattered windows assaults FLASH as he charges in. He stumbles forward as the plane noses into a dive. Recoveri he scrambles into the left-hand seat, grabs hold of the bucking wheel yoke, pulls back and kicks at the rudder pe DALE lurches in against the tornado.
Can you fly it?
I can fly all right -- I've had a couple of lessons! -- just don't if I can land!
Grab that other wheel! Help me pull her up! DALE staggers into the co-pilot's seat, pulls back on the wheel in front of her.
Oh boy! Ever hear about the man who fell ninety stories from a window and didn't break a bone?
No but I'd sure like to! How'd The man fall ninety stories didn't break a bone?
The window was ninety-one stories up!

The Earth is approaching fast, wheeling and tilting. We g a glimpse of a strange greenhouse structure at the end of flat area. Another barrage of crackling RED LIGHTNING BOLTS shoot al around the plane but just miss it.
Brace yourself I'm aiming at that field up ahead!

Its thousands of panes reflect the RED SUN and the RED BO which rain down in intermittent bursts. One strikes an en of a gallery, exploding glass and foliage. From inside, w HEAR a furious echoing VOICE:
I see you, Munson! Come out or I shoot! 8.
(MUNSON, ZARKOV)
ZARKOV is on the lower stairs of the tower, aiming his revolver. MUNSON emerges from some dry brown bush where h was hiding.
So what's it matter if I'm shot or go up in that thing? I'm a goner either way, right?
Of course -- I admit that! But this way you'll be giving your life for a chance of saving Earth! Haven't you any spirit at all??
Goodbye, Doctor -- they were all right about you. Have a nice trip. MUNSON starts walking away, toward the door at the end of the long side wing.

I tell you I can't take it off alone! If you won't come, who will I find? If you woo't come, who will I find: MUNSON ignores him totally, keeps walking away. ZARKOV li his revolver and draws a bead on the man's back. Just as is about to shoot, he reacts to something outside.

Amazingly, a Twin Otter is gliding in to a horribly rough landing in the field outside. The plane hits on one wheel bounces into the air, comes down again and keeps right on rolling toward the greenhouse.
SEEING the onrushing plane, freezing an instant then star to run. He hardly gets five yards before the Twin Otter c SLAMMING IN through the greenhouse wall, burying MUNSON totally under the wreckage.
(DALE, FLASH)
Crazily angled, filled with dust and smoke. Dazed, blood his forehead, FLASH struggles from his seat. 9.
Dale! Are you all right?
I'm terrific.
Flash Gordon, you have just made me a Giant fan for life.
Come on -- let's get out before she blows! FLASH helps her from the wrecked seat, wheels and kicks o the emergency exit in the cockpit area.
(DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)
FLASH lowers DALE to the ground, jumps down after her. ZA is there, smiling at them in a strange way.
Hello. i'm Flash Gordon, this is Miss Dale Arden --
Delighted to see you.
This crazy storm knocked us down could we use a phone?
Certainly. Just follow me -- up those stairs.
Some weather huh?
It will get worse. ZARKOV turns and smiles at them again as they start up th tower stairs. SUddenly DALE stops short, staring at ZARKO with a funny expression.
You're Dr. Hans Zarkov! ZARKOV hesitates just an instant, the nods.
How did you know? 10.
I saw you in PEOPLE mag. After you left NASA, remember? It said you were utterly --- DALE breaks off, almost biting her tongue.
Insane? Off my rocker?
I forget what it said:
Flash, let's find some other phone, okay? I'm sure Dr. Zarkov is very busy....... FLASH is baffled, but he gets her urgent look.
Well, all right -- but it seems to me we ought to -- Now it's FLASH'S turn to break off. ZARKOV is pointing a gun at him.
Up the stairs to the tower! Ahead of me -- quick! -- (as they gape at him,
Quick I said: We haven't much time -- Earth is being attacked! -- there's only one slim chance of saving it!
Mister, you are insane! HOWL of ether-wind increases. Storm of RED LASER BOLTS. G showers them as parts of the green house EXPLODE and dry foliage bursts into FLAME.
Up the stairs -- RUN! ZARKOV jabs the revolver into DALE'S back. RED BOLTS zap around. FLASH whispers to her as they start running up ah of ZARKOV.
Go with the flow -- wait for a chance! Below them, bottom of staircase disintergrates in a RED F 11.
(DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)

ZARKOV rips away a screen of foliage, revealing a MIRROR BRIGHT capsule, seamless but for one door. He yanks that open. On every side things are blowing up and burning under the merciless rain of bolts. One strikes the capsule head on, but does not even leave a mark.
I need your help to take off! Get in or I shot you dead! DALE gasps and shrinks back.
Take off for where?

God only knows -- whatever black corner of space this is coming from -- wherever HE is!. -- we'll plunge into the devil's heart and destroy him! We'll die ourselves, of course, but our names will be honored till the end of time!
Look, Doc -- I don't book kamikaze tours -- never. FLASH is poised to jump, but ZARKOV suddenly pushes DALE balance, INTO the capsule. FLASH leaps after her.
(DALE, ZARKOV)

It is curiously transparent from the inside, mirrored onl on the exterior. There are some controls and displays, bu in general the interior is severely ascetic: as far remov from conventional spacecraft as ZARKOV's solitary genius from everyday science. Immediately starting to set switches in a frenzy of activ ZARKOV waves the gun at FLASH.
Sit down there! Foot on the red pedal!

Flash! Sack him! 12. ZARKOV wheels and pulls the door shut. FLASH jumps him. H punches ZARKOV in the gut. ZARKOV slams him back with the well-known strength of a madman. FLASH clobbers him again Falling, ZARKOV dives sidewards and hits a switch. The capsule WHINES SOFTLY and begins to WHIRL. Looking ou through the transparent wall, it is as if the capsule its was motionless and the scene outside is whirling. What's left of the greenhouse is under a constant rain of those LASER BOLTS, flashing fire that makes us dizzy. FLASH staggers to his feet and finds DALE, folds his arms around her protectively. The centrifugal force is rapidly increasing now, throws them both against the wall. Faster and faster, whirling, the force presses DALE'S body back against FLASH'S until they are almost one flesh. We move over and find ZARKOV plastered against another pa of the whirling capsule, his face drained white and disto by the terrific G-Force operating here now, his lips movi as he speaks with enormous effort:
Friendship...Built this to send to them in...Friendship...The end now...End of the world....Unless we (every sound an effort
Unless...We...Three...Can... ZARKOV'S eyes close. He loses consciousness.

Totally ablaze within now, one huge fantastic jewel of fi The whole central tower explodes outward. From the infern MIRROR-BRIGhT capsule slowly rises, hovers, begins pickin up speed again as it ascends.
Whirling, whirling, invincibly unharmed by the LASER BOLT which glance off it again and again, accelerating up into space.

The EARTH recedes below into a ball, RED-HUED' under the fantastic sun. A fast approaching light FLARES up against the mirrored surface and is recognised as our MOON. It fl past, follows EARTH into e distance. All around, the sky darkens into the void of space.

head_text.subj: OUTER PLANETS OF OUR SOLAR SYSTEM

text: They hurtle past the capsule in rapid sequences:

A sudden gauntlet of careening ASTEROIDS, all sizes, from tiny zingers to one almighty tumbler big as AFRICA. Mammoth JUPITER with thirteen moons and its atmosphere of deadly methane clouds more than 1000 miles deep. The RED PATCH on its surface is a storm 20,000 miles across which has raged without intermission for 200 EARTH centuries. Through the RINGS OF SATURN in a dazzling LIGHTSTORM of blazing ice crystals. NEPTUNE, PLUTO, outermost URANUS. One after another the planets are left hurtling behind, wheeling in their conce orbits, the entire SOLAR SYSTEM dwindling into nothing.
It tilts and wheels wondrously as the Capsule passes thro the middle of it. Considering that this Nebula is probabl million light-years from edge to edge, we get some notion the Capsule's speed.

Curving light-rays from another galaxy are drawn fantasti together and then simply DISAPPEAR as they are pulled in the unimaginable gravitation force of is THING. we SEE th CAPSULE, tiny, curving, and spinning along amidst the min blowing display of light rays, sucked along with them  then simply DISAPPEARING as it too enters the void.
(KLYTUS, MING)

Visible again, gleaming in an AMBER GLOW. Suddenly a danc grid of lines appears OVER IT, making us realise that we must be SEEING IT on some kind of screen. It BLURS out of focus, comes back again more sharply as some adjustment h apparently been made.
Deep in shadow, gleaming with evil amusement.
Curve of lip, flare of nostril, fold of eyelid, gleam of shaven scalp, each a menacing landscape of sensual shadow
They survived our Black Hole -- 14.
Hail Ming! Shall I drown them in the Sea of Fire?
Later, Klytus -- I think we will look at them first.

Through the transparent walls as the spinning motion is rapidly SLOWING DOWN. The three voyagers are crumpled on floor against the wall in strange attitudes, FLASH'S arms still holding DALE. They seem semi-conscious, as if dropp An AMBER GLOW bathes them, and soon we see its source. A huge planet wheels into view through the transparent wall It is MONGO. Its curved surface is a pure sea of AMBER FI molten lava, with great tongues of flame erupting horrifically. ZARKOV blinks, struggles to focus his eyes. He succeeds, with horror SEES where they are headed. Making a choking sound, ZARKOV stirs and tries to crawl over to a control panel. He pushes switches. Nothing happens. The CAPSULE keeps on going down. A great leaping tongue of fire licks it. Suddenly, just as destruction seems imminent, the capsule miraculously changes its flight path and soars above the remaining flames. It races through them. A shadow passes over MONGO as the CAPSULE passes through a wall of PURPLE VAPOR and emerges above a totally different landscape. A dozen VARIOUS COLO CLOUDS sweep past in silent majesty. The CAPSULE slows, hovers starts straight down into a sea high grass.

In the distant B.G. against an extraordinary SUNSET SKY, rises the shimmering CITY OF MONGO.... a place of many le golden tiers and turrets, towers, flags and pennants. It like something dreamed. Several STRANGELY ARMORED MEN watch the MIRROR-BRIGHT CAP descending slowly. The LEADER waves and they all start to the CAPSULE.
(DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)
Gentle bump as the thing touches down. 15.
By God, we did it! We made it!
Made it where, Doctor?
I don't know. Suddenly DALE gasps, reacting to something she SEES throu the transparent-from-within wall. They all look around an SEE those STRANGE MEN approaching.
Don't. Suddenly I like it in here just fine --
(ARMORED MEN, FLASH, LEADER, ZARKOV)

The door of the CAPSULE is opened from the inside. ZARKOV and DALE and FLASH get out. THE MEN stop. Long beat as th two parties gaze at each other, the first human eye ever see an extraterrestrial being. FLASH walks up to the lead
Hello -- my name's Flash Gordon -- can you understand me?
We're from EARTH -- we come as friends.
Extend your hand! That's the gesture of friendship known everywhere! With a warm grin, FLASH extends hi right hand.
Hi! CLACK! With lightning speed a manacle is slammed on FLASH wrist and he is thrown to the ground as other RED MEN adv to handcuff DALE and ZARKOV.
You are prisoners. I will take you now to Ming the Merciless, Ruler of the universe!
Hail, Ming! 16. Groggily, FLASH lifts his head towards ZARKOV.
Thanks, Doctor -- next time I'll call my own play.
(DALE, FLASH)

Another strange glimpse through an opening. Some fierce tethered BEAST is being goaded and tormented by MONGO MEN as in an Elizabethan bear-baiting. On the floor lies the tor n body of one MAN who apparently got too close. DALE has one brief horrified GLIMPSE of this, then turns head away and shuts her eyes as she's marched along.
Just do what I'm doing. Flash --
What are you doing?
Shutting my eyes -- dreaming I booked us to Disneyland.

A gigantic STATUE comes into view amidst topless columns the end. Light plays over it in ever-shifting patterns. A we come nearer, we SEE that this STATUE is cut out in the middle to form a throne. MING THE MERCILESS sits in the throne niche, silent, gazi down on the PRISONERS as they are marched to a halt befor him.

Hail, Ming! Hail, Great One Without Mercy! A hundred reduplicated ECHOES of that shout ring through unseen reaches of the palace. MING bends his head slightl in acknowledgement, points idly at the ARMORED MEN at the left of the group.

As FLASH, DALE and ZARKOV are marched along by many ARMOR MEN, perspectives are bewildering, curvilinear, surfaces 17. bending away into caverns of gloom without measurable dimension. We pass an archway opening into what seems to be an AMUSE NT ARCADE. Glimpse of MONGO PEOPLE playing amazing electr games, while MONGO GO-GO GIRLS cavort on a platform to unearthly music.
Fantastic -- into a Black Hole and out the other side -- to this. Who said Hans Zarkov was mad?

You're mad. Look down over a balcony from a MOVING POV. A fencing gla is in session. SIX PAIRS OF MEN go at each other with mag swords which give off pyrotechnical displays each time th blades clash. Thrust, parry, SLASH! The head of one duell EXPLODES in a bloodless fountain of fire.
You got us into this -- HOW DO WE
Get out? Why? We're being taken to Ming -- getting at him is our only hope of saving EARTH. It's perfect!
Dr. Zarkov, I'm about to show you what it feels like to be clipped by a New York Giant --
Flash, it's no use - he's too crazy!
Step forward, Soldier. The designated one marches two paces forward, halts.
Are you loyal to Ming? Would you die for him?
Gladly!

Fall on your sword. 18. Instantly the ARMORED MAN pulls his sword, rips open his breast-plate, sets the sword hilt-down on the floor and PLUNGES FORWARD on to the fatal point. With a little cry of horror, DALE shrinks back into FLASH arms.
You inhuman fiend!

Of course I'm "inhuman"! -- that's a compliment! (Dropping his voice) Pathetic Earthlings, forever wondering if you are alone in the universe -- beaming you plaintive messages into to the void for anything that might hear you -- even hurling your bodies out into it -- and all without the faintest inkling of who or what is out here. If you had known anything -- anything at all about the true nature of the universe, you would have hidden from it, in terror! There is a low throaty LAUGH from the shadows. FLASH and DALE turn their eyes quickly in its direction.

Emerging half into the light beside a column, fondling th head of an obscure BEAST slouching between her legs. Voluptuous beyond her years, fiercely erotic, AURA looks FLASH boldly up and down as the BEAST HISSES with the ple of her touch. FLASH can't take his eyes off her. No normal man could. F swallows with a dry throat as AURA'S gaze devours him. DA gets the electricity going on, gives him a poke and WHISP LOUDLY.
Watch it, fella -- you came with me! AURA laughs again, sidles up toward MING. We dimly SEE a couple of MUTANT CREATURES dragging away the lifeless bod of the one who so vividly proved his loyalty.
You know who Ming is now -- who are you and why do you come to Mongo? 19.
I'm Flash Gordon of the New York Giants this is Dale Arden -- Dr.Zarkov hijacked us in an effort to save EARTH. MING looks questioningly at KLYTUS
Sirs, Earth is the meaningless planet you are in the process of obliterating.
(pouncing on that) In the process? You mean Earth still exists?
For the moment -- not for much longer.
But why? What in hell have we ever done to hurt you?

You exist -- and yet you pay no homage to Ming! What greater crime can be committed? The palace rings with an answering chorus: VOICES of all ARMORED MEN and numerous others presently UNSEEN, includi many WOMEN.
Hail, Ming! Hail, Great One Without Mercy!

Come closer, Dale Arden -- let me see you. DALE doesn't move. MING takes a step down, narrows his ey and gazes at her intensely. This guy's personal magnetism is enormous. As if irresistibly drawn, DALE steps forward MING moves his hand in a gesture. A sourceless GOLDEN LIG bathes DALE, sensuous MUSICAL CHORDS are heard. DALE's li open slightly, her color heightens, her rate of breathing increases. MING touches her flesh lightly. FLASH tense, ready to spring.
This woman will amuse you. 20.
Klytus can see the future, eh?
He can foresee it -- but for a few moments only. It gives him a unique gift for survival, -- and treachery.

Extraordinary. I'd like to study his beta factors -- I wager I could extend them with a course of telekinetic exercise. (peering at KLYTUS) Tell me -- when you use this fit does your temporal lobe prickle? Here? MING flashes a glance of interest at ZARKOV, then address the LEADER of the ARMORED MEN.
Chain this one up. Preserve him for further examination.
Hail, Ming! ZARKOV is roughly seized. FLASH starts after them angrily as they drag the scientist away.
Oh no you don't! We came together and we're STAYING together! Languidly, MING indicates FLASH GORDON with a pointed fin
That one is useless to us. Remove him and kill him. Shock reactions. FLASH wheels back at MING as DALE steps front of her friend.
You dirty old bastard can kill me too!
Wetting her lips, moving sinuously to WHISPER to MING: 21.
Don't kill him yet, Father. Give him to me!
What would your Prince Barin say?
I can handle Barin.
Really, Aura -- your appetites are too monstrous -- even for our family. This could cause great trouble with Barin -- I must forbid it. AURA touches the rime of MING'S ear with her tongue as sh
But you adore me, Father -- you ca refuse me nothing . Yes?
As MING steps quickly away from his super-provocative dau and indicates DALE.

Take the Earth-woman to our quarters! Bathe and annoint her for our pleasure! A HOODED GUARD comes from shadow, moves towards DALE. FLASH starts around to defend her, but before he can do i DALE has made her own move. WHAM! Quick as lightning, she flattened the HOODED GUARD with a perfectly executed city girl's kick to the balls. DALE is astonished at her own prowess.
My God -- and I thought that book was another rip-off-
Watch out! Behind you! Three more HOODED GUARDS are emerging from the shadows to DALE.

FLASH flies at them. An elbow in the mouth disposes of on He seizes the man's mace-like club as he falls, uses it quickly to knock cold the other two. AURA'S eyes shine at FLASH'S prowess. Fascinated, she run her moist tongue along the cutting edge of her teeth. Panting, braced, FLASH stands in front of DALE with raise mace. Unearthly MARTIAL MUSIC comes in a glissando from the Cavernous space above. To its tempo MING'S PERSONAL GUARDS now starts appearing. They are all a race of AMAZON WARRIORS, and the most amaz thing is that they all have the SAME FACE. From left to right, back and front, the AMAZONS advance 0 FLASH and DALE. They do not attack, merely stun ad overwh us with their massive, silent, answerable threat. FLASH swallows, looks this way and that, stands as if paralysed.
(low and tremulous) What's the play, Flash?
I can't -- I just can't --
Can't what?
Clobber a woman, Dale --
You damn fool, those aren't women they're murderous AMAZON DYKES! The AMAZONS are all around DALE now.
Help!! FLASH is paralyzed by indecision one beat more, then sudd makes up his mind. He flies into action, SLAMS the neares pair of AMAZONS. 23.

Fast and furious. Great havoc is wreaked by DALE and her karate, by FLASH and his flailing fists, but the AMAZONS' numerical superiority is of course decisive. Soon FLASH is on the floor, pinioned by a dozen AMAZONS. He looks up, with despairing eyes SEES poor DALE being dr up a flight of stairs that disappear mysteriously into up gloom.
Flash!! The pitiful shout sends FLASH'S adrenaline rushing. With superhuman effort, he fights free from the pile-up and da after DALE.
FLASH struggles to get through to DALE. DALE claws fiercely at the bare AMAZON arms and shoulders that engulf her, reaches desperately back down for FLASH.
Just touching their fingertips.

Opens like a yawning trap door UNDER FLASH'S FEET. FLASH drops away with a YELL, in the very instant that AU comes running INTO THE SHOT and boldly JUMPS after him. AURA is swallowed up too, a split-second before the trap door step CLOSES again after them.
(KLYTUS, MING)
Watching that, as KLYTUS hisses into his ear.
She betrays you! She'll take him to Aboria!
So Prince Barin will kill Flash Gordon for me -- I don't care.
Don't be too sure! 24. MING glances at him, then back up the stairs at where DAL has vanished. His face softens, his tone turns museful!
I haven't taken a wife in centuries. I could bring myself to marry this Dale Arden --

What do you see in her future, Klytus? NO reply. MING turns his head and finds that KLYTUS is go Vanished. Not particularly surprised or concerned, MING g again toward the top of the stairs and answers his own question with a licentious smile.
(AURA, FLASH)

It is seemingly endless, faintly lt by phosphoresence fro below. We dimly make out the figures of FLASH and AURA fa away from us, far below, falling, falling. We HEAR Hollow echoing VOICES reverbrating up to us.
Take a deep breath! Grab my ankle after we hit the water -- I'll lead you!
Hit what water? In answer, we instantly HEAR a titanic SPLASH.

FLASH plummets down, AURA right after him. Recovering bal in a universe of bubbles, FLASH finds himself confronting enormous savage LUMINOUS FISH. Wheeling himself away in fear and revulsion, FLASH encounters AURA. He seizes her ankle as directed. Holding his beat, FLASH swims after he through a maze of stalagmites growing up from the cavern floor. AURA dives down, leads him OUT OF SIGHT through a opening.
(AURA, FLASH, PLASH)
FLASH and AURA emerge from a pool of water. FLASH stagger across and collapses on a fringe of beach. For sure, AURA wet clinging robe doesn't make her look any less sexy. He stares at her.
Catch your breath -- then I'll take you up and find you a disguise. 25.

Are startled as the arrow WHIRRS in and sticks into the b under their feet. The branch instantly turns to ICE.

HEARS a loud brittle CRACKING SOUND. He looks up, gapes, holds on tight to the tree trunk. A dozen SHRIEKING TREE plummet down around him amidst chunks of ICE, crashing th the branches to doom. A look of fierce delight on his fac BARIN resumes his climb.
(FLASH, TIGER MAN)

FLASH and TIGER MAN jump from their basket into a wide le near a loading platform where the elevator-vine goes arou a great iron wheel. The forest is open to the sky at this altitude, a sunny Eden of huge exotic flowers. Enormous overlapping leaves form a floor FLASH and TIGER MAN can s on.
Which way to the border:
Legend says Arboria ends in an ocean to the west. FLASH quickly checks his wristwatch and the angle of the shadows, starts in the direction he estimates is west.

FLASH and TIGER MAN running over the leaves, which are somewhat BOUNCY like a huge trampoline. It's quite enjoya FLASH laughs aloud at the sensation, takes a big jump off the edge of one leaf, BOUNCES HIGH from the next. Amazingly, a fat TENDRIL seizes him in mid-air, coils aro his waist. FLASH yells as he is lifted further up.

is right above him. The closed petals open. The inside is viscous, hideous looking. In the deepest recess is a dark red blob which PULSES like a huge heart, emits a BEING SO With horror, FLASH realizes the tendril is feeding him in the flower's maw. PLASH struggles vainly against the tendril's strength. TI MAN dashes to his rescue below, but another tendril knock him flat.
(BARIN, FLASH)

FLASH is conveyed INTO the flower. He punches wildly with his fists, kicks, but petals are CLOSING inexorably aroun him. On their inner surface are deadly spiny SPIKES. Scattered around are the crushed SKELETONS of luckless TR MEN who have been fed in here. SWISH-PFFFFST! Out of nowhere a GLASS ARROW comes flying past FLASH'S ear, sinks itself into the flower's heart. T flower SHRIEKS. All around, FLASH, it is turning into crystalline ICE. The tendrils lose their grip, FLASH falls onto the leaf b beside the TIGER MAN.
As FLASH turns his head to see BARIN standing with his crossbow on a leaf some twenty feet away.
I saved you because your death must be mine.

What's the point of all this killing? Why don't we team up and overthrow Ming? BARIN notches another arrow, cocks his bow, with slow ple raises it and aims at FLASH'S heart. Suddenly a SHADOW co BARIN. He jerks his head up to SEE:
Diving from the sun at him. It is a HAWKMAN, magnificient fierce. It seizes BARIN in its talons and lifts him INTO AIR.
Hover, their wings beating the air. They dive on FLASH an TIGER MAN, lift them too. 52.
Rises in a steep climb over Arboria.
In the pilot's seat gazes OFF at something through tricky little binoculars.
Ascending with their three captives-
Put the binoculars down, with one hand lowers the THOUGHT TRANSFER hood over her head, with the other waves the cra into a sharp turn away from the HAWKMEN. Without her lips
Princess Aura returns to Mingo City The passage through the force-field opens at her approach -- AURA twists the tuning dial, then goes on in a soft
Daddy darling -- am I with you? Are you getting me?
Sits some fanciful form of ground transport: perhaps a th with bicycle wheels and sails.
(DALE, ZARKOV)
They are inside, she watching tensely as ZARKQV throws switches and eyes displays.
Will it fly?
Basic circuits seem okay.
It has-to fly! We gotta rescue FLASH from that vampire before she -- Sudden BLINDING BLUE LIGHT explodes within the capsule. 53.
Jump!!
(DALE, ZARKOV)
Come diving out headlong into the grass.
What happened?
Heaven knows. I was just starting to test the primary transformer-banks
ZARKOV stops abruptly, looking down at himself. DALE gasp
My God -- your hands! Your hands are gone! It is true: ZARKOV has no hands.

Not gone -- Just invisible. See? INVISIBLE HANDS pick up a pebble from the ground, hold it before DALE'S nose. Magically, they toss the little objec back and forth from one UNSEEN HAND to the other. DALE to one, can feel it.
Does it hurt?

Not a bit. I believe Mongo's gravitational. field must have reversed the polarity of my generator so that -- He breaks off again. Slowly, in front of our eyes, ZARKOV HANDS are FADING IN, again and becoming VISIBLE. DALE whi in amazement.
Neat trick. I wonder if it's controllable? SHADOW over them suddenly. Great WHIRRING of wings. DALE Looks up and SCREAMS.
Swoop down on ZARKOV and DALE, bear them aloft as they di with FLASH AND TIGER MAN.
(KLYTUS, MING)

In his wonderous DOME ROOM, watching something. PULL BACK KLYTUS is beside him as usual. ANGLE to include the VIEWI SCREEN which MING is watching. On it is a directional continuation of the scene we just saw: a struggling DALE being Carrie dup into the open sky by HAWKMEN.
Mongo is restless today. Your vessels stray from their appointed kingdoms....
That damned Vultan -- time I clipped his wings once and for all. We could put those insolent Hawkmen of his to work in the plasma cavern ----
Dale Arden and Flash Gordon? Will I send out the Imperial Fleet to bring them back?
We'll let Vultan tame her first -- I'll look pretty to Dale Arden after him. Flash Gordon is nobody. KLYTUS smiles that sinister way. MING looks at him questioningly.
Sire, it is not for me to tell Great, Ming that he is making mistakes.
(HAWKMAN, TIGER MAN)
Serried squadrons of HAWKMEN escort the ones bearing FLAS BARIN and TIGER MAN through space.
Struggling against the TWO HAWKMEN who have him, snarling and roaring. He butts one in the belly with his horn.
Want us to let you go, et? 55.
Yes!!
Okay.
Nooo!!!

Light streams rough tremendous El Greco clouds. HAWKMEN A tiny figures, rising against it. Higher, higher. Above the clouds a blinding DAZZLE comes INTO FRAME. It resolves into a fantastic SKY PALACE hangi in mid-air, reflecting sunlight from myriad turrets and terraces. The HAWKMEN climb above it.
Carrying FLASH and BARIN and TIGER MAN , going into a screaming dive.
Rushing at us with horrifying speed. ZOOMING DOWN we see dark opening. The wind howling around wings, we rush dizz into the aperture.

VULTAN circles admiringly around DALE. VULTAN is a lusty viking of the sky, winged like his men, one eye blinded, beard cloven by an old scar from forehead to jaw. Gorgeou HAWKGIRLS watch jealously as VULTAN inspects DALE very closely, reaches out a sly hand and touches her bosom. DA slaps his hand away.
Watch out, you old bird -- Ming wants to marry me. VULTAN hoots at that as HAWKGIRLS murmur. He's about to touch her again when there is a CLAMOR o.s. VULTAN reacts
(BARIN, DALE, FLASH, SARIN, VULTAN, ZARKOV, ZAAKOV)

HAWKMEN carrying FLASH, TIGER MAN and BARIN swoop OUT fro another hole like the one they dove into. The whole place like a great hanging birdhouse, HAWKWOMEN and HAWCHILDREN moving in and out and perching on the various exterior terraces. 56. FLASH and TIGER MAN Are dropped on to a terrace, so hard it stuns them.
Is lowered more carefully on another terrace, this one grander, with a throne in the center.
Flying down from above, hovering above BARIN with menacin glee.
Ho! -- Barin! - I knew my Hawkmen would catch you one of these days.
Be careful how you address me, Vultan. I am Prince Barin, ruler of Arboria.
Not in my Kingdom -- here you're just a stray animal to be killed for our sport!
Will you do that, Vultan?
What would you do if you'd caught me in Arboria?

Yes -- I would hunt you down and kill you without mercy. FLASH on the OTHER TERRACE Lifts his head groggily, reacts to something. ANGLE TO INCLUDE ZARKOV, stumbling out from an opening in his usua clothes.
Hello - we do meet in the strangest places.
Where's Dale?
The boss-bird has her up in his 57. Sudden ear-piercing SCREAM from above. DALE'S scream, FLA bounds to his feet.
DALE is surrounded by jealous HAWKGIRLS who are pushing h toward the terrace edge. Screaming again, DALE goes OVER.

head_text.subj: SPACE BETWEEN TWO TERRACES/ ONE TERRACE

text: FLASH wheels toward the sound, dives to the parapet and catches DALE as she plunges past.
Flash! Oh darling!
Dale baby! He hauls her in and they embrace in a steamy kiss. FLUTTE of wings. HAWKMEN swoop at the terrace and LIFT UP the clinging couple. It barely interrupts their conversation:
Flash -- when I was in that tub --
Yes -- it was me --
Did you mean it?
Every thought, baby! --
(BARIN, DALE, FLASH, HAWKPEOPLE, TIGER MAN, VULTAN)
As FLASH and DALE are lowered on it.
No. What have you to say to Vultan, Prince of the Air?
We're all Ming's prisoners. I say let's team up and smash him.
Listen to his words! --
On his feet on the other terrace, shouting across: 58.
I know -- I'm only an ignorant Tiger Man -- but I tell you Flash Gordon is the leader we've waited for!
Where VULTAN gazes at TIGER MAN a beat, then turns mockin eyes on FLASH.
You're a leader, he?
Well, back home it's what I'm paid for -- I called a pretty good game against the Dallas Cowboys once ---
Do you understand him?
Not a word.
I was hunting him when you seized me. Before you finish me. Vultan I beg only that you let me finish him.
Oh god -- here we go again --
Is everyone on Mongo CRAZY? Haven't you guys ever heard of TEAMWORK?
When I had that damn snake in my hand, I could've poked it in your face and KILLED you.
I had you in bow-sight you were dead!
Enough! (shouting to all around) These vagrants talk a brave fight, my Hawkmen! Shall we test their words?
CHEERING AND SHOUTING eagerly from all around:
Test them! -- Let's have sport! The joust! -- To the joust! --
Take them below -- put them together.
(DALE, FLASH, ZARKOV)
VULTAN leads the way down. FLASH, BARIN, DALE, ZAAKOV and TIGER MAN are escorted by many fierce HAWKMEN.
Flash - don't do this.
(low, bitter) I've got to.
Why?
He has no choice, Dale it's the Mongo way.
I'm so homesick -- what I wouldn't give for a nice quiet night with some muggers in Central Park -- FLASH squeezes DALE'S hand. Ahead appears an archway opening to the sky. A GREAT GONG is heard.
ANGLE - HAWKMAN appears with a mallet, he beats again on huge bronze GONG.
Startling sight: A big DISC hangs in the air between the curved prongs of a lower terrace, the shaft that supports lost in clouds below. 60.
FLASH and the OTHERS appear. They halt, looking at the di
Prepare them!
Is GREASING the shiny surface with a mop, slipping around bit as he does so.
SHOTS - ASH AND BARIN getting prepared. Removing shirts b equipped with heavy leather gauntlets, and so on. Each is given a long vicious WHIP.
ANGLE - a bridge-like plank extends itself, out over the edge of the shiny greased disc. FLASH and BARIN appear, r for combat. HAWKMEN behind them, wthey start out over the bridge.
Arm the disc!
Stopping short, eyes popping, as he SEES:
Razor sharp knives are POPPING UP from the top surface al over, maybe two feet apart. If a man loses his footing an falls he will surely be fatally impaled.
(BARIN, DALE, FLASH, MING'S VOICE, VULTAN, ZARKOV)
FEATURE FLASH and BARIN with whips in hand, they step fro the bridge onto the disc. FLASH almost slips and falls immediately.
Flash!!
Getting his balance again. BARIN moves across amidst the knives, takes a stance facing FLASH, raises and coils bac his whip.
Ready for me, Earthling?
I ask you to swear, Barin -- if you defeat me, you'll join Vultan against Ming! If for no other reasons, because you'll never have Aura as long as her father lives!-
What do you now of Aura?
Quite a lot! ZWIPPP! BARIN'S whip lashes out savagely at FLASH.

Suddenly the fight begins. FLASH and BARIN stalk around, slipping on the grease, whamming at each other with their whips. The disc suddenly begins to TILT and SWAY, making this affair even more desperate. BARIN begins to get an edge. Slashing, cutting, he drives FLASH back.
Flash, I love you! Win for me, Flash!??

Adrenaline courses through his veins as he hears that ove the uproar. He flies at BARIN, dodges the lash, grapples with him han to-hand. They wrestle their way tot he very rim of the swaying til surface. It looks bad again for FLASH, when with a superh effort he flips BARIN over his back... over the edge! In the same instant, FLASH dives onto his side amidst the deadly knives and grabs at BARIN'S wrist. 62. FLASH catches him. BARIN hangs suspended over the abyss o space held only by FLASH'S grip.
You've won, Earthling! Drop him to doom!
(gasping at BARIN) Try to catch my wrist! -- the other one.
What is this??
Call it what you want, Vultan -- compassion -- mercy: let us teach you the meaning of these words.
Swing your body -- see if you can get a leg up here! Suddenly an ECHOING VOICE BOOMS from the sky:
Vultan! Hear Ming, Ruler of the Universe!
(AURA, MING, MING'S VOICE, VULTAN, ZARKOV)
Where MING watches the SKY PALACE SCENE on a viewing scre a weeping AURA beside him, as he goes on:
I see you, Vultan -- and Barin too! You both have defied we by sparing these Earthlings!
Barin -- my only -- I swear I didn't mean to get you into this!
As the VOICE goes on:
Do you want to live, Vultan?
What creature wants to die? 63.

Then kill Flash Gordon now! Pick up Dale Arden, deliver her to me on your own wings -- it's your only chance! My fleet is already in the air, ready to destroy your whole Kingdom if you disobey! The ECHO rolls and dies.
TIGER MAN suddenly leaps out onto the disc, slides over between the knives, helps FLASH pull BARIN up to safety.
ZARKOV in his chains, walks over to the confused VULTAN..
What'll you have -- death or dishonor? VULTAN looks down at FLASH once more, then makes up his m He shouts to his people:
We'll save these Earthlings! - Curse Ming! -- Into the air, my Hawkpeople - fly! ZARKOV grins, extends a hand to VULTAN. He just looks at it.
I don't understand this. I think I've gone mad.
(AURA, MING)
MING snaps off the viewing screen, looks at AURA
Spare him Daddy -- oh please spare
AURA tries to throw herself into his arm, but he pushes h roughly away. KLYTUS materialises from a shadow, smiling.
You've always wanted her, Klytus -- Aura is yours. 64.
It is being evacuated. Squadrons of HAWAKPEOPLE stream ou of its many openings, diminutive figures against the sky.
Several ROCKET-SHIPS appear, wonderfully gaudy contraptio with MING's battle-flags flying. A RAY shoots out from th nose of the biggest.
The RAY zaps it. The whole place EXPLODES.
(DALE, FLASH, VULTAN, ZARKOV)
VULTAN and his CAPTAIN lead. Ranged around are BARIN, FLA DALE ,TIGER MAN and ZARKOV, each carried by a HAWKMAN. Di explosions rumble like thunder.
Don't look back, Hawkman. Head for that cloud-cover! (over his shoulder) Where's this capsule of yours, exactly?
In the high grass east of Mingo.
Pick it up, Captain! The CAPTAIN and a FEW HAWKMEN peel off. FLASH and DALE Gaze at each other lovingly, flown along about a hundred feet apart. He calls for her:
Guess the first thing you and me are gonna do after we land..!
Darling not in front of the Hawkmen -- you'll make me blush! --
Gonna do it first thing -- around here, never know if you'll get another chance! 65. Dark SHADOW falls over DALE. She looks up.
A big ROCKET SHIP hovers, doors in its bottom side openin A flickering RAY shoots down.

head_text.subj: BACK TO THE HAWKMEN AND OTHERS IN SKY

text: As an effulgent GLOW envelopes her. Inexorably, DALE and her HAWKMEN are sucked upward.
Help!!
I'm coming, Dale! (to his Hawkmen) Follow her -- climb! VULTAN's command of course takes precedence. The HAWKMAN bearing FLASH follows his mates into a shrieking vertical dive.
(DALE, HEDONIA)

DALE and her HAWKMAN are sucked up into a chamber. Waitin SOLDIERS seize the struggling HAWKMAN, brutally smash his wings pitch him OUT the bottom as the doors close. DALE backs off, drops into a karate stance, With a WHININ ROAR the craft accelerates throwing DALE off balance agai a wall. HEDONIA enters through a door, her arms full seem to be yards and yards of filmy white material. HEDONIA Sm nicely.
Time is short. Ming sent me to fit you with is.
Fit me with what?
Your wedding dress.

TREE MEN and LION MEN and TIGER MAN toil together in peac concernt, constructing a crude wooden launch-gantry aroun ZARKOV'S SPACE CAPSULE, which has been conveyed here. 66. Several hovering HAWKMEN hold it in position with vine ca as the work is completed. Capsule door is open. Through i we see ZARKOV at work inside, feverishly re-wiring a cont panel.
(BARIN, FLASH, VULTAN, ZARKOV'S VOICE)

Up on Lodge Balcony, FLASH, BARIN and VULTAN lean over a table on which maps and drawings are laid out, a typical military staff meeting. With a bit of charcoal, BARIN ske a semi-circular line over a map of MING'S city.
A force-field covers the whole city, from here to here. With luck, Flash can lure them into lowering their defenses.
What if he fails?
This is suicide, Barin! I can't order my men to suicide! VULTAN ascends into the air. Hovers as he goes on:
The flight brought me back to my senses -- good luck and goodbye.
Ming destroyed your kingdom!
We'll build another.
Vultan!
Let him go -- I understand. (up to Vultan) Thanks anyway for getting us this far! VULTAN hesitates a moment, the soars away with determinat
Flash! Ready for a test!
(FLASH, ZARKOV)
What's the game-plan?
Sit there. When I give you zero, punch that button. Any questions?
(BARIN, FLASH'S VOICE, ZARKOV)
ZARKOV jumps out, leaving the door open. He crouches low. BARIN and VULTAN and EVERYBODY are watching.
Five, four, three, two, one -- ZERO! Interior of the capsule is filled with BLINDING BLUE LIGH for an instant. ZARKOV pops up, sticks his head in.
Flash!
Do you hear me, Flash? Where are you?
As INVISIBLE HANDS turn around the helmet on his head.
Eureka! I did it! You can come out now, Flash --
Not unless you get out of my way, I
ZARKOV moves inside.

Look -- he still casts a shadow: It's true. FLASH is totally invisible, but on the ground SEE his shadow as he climbs out and stands upright. Suddenly there is rising WHINING HUMMING SOUND that seems fill the whole firmament. The earth trembles. LION MEN an TREE MEN cower in terror. TIGER MAN roars.
Zarkov! What have you done? 68. The SOUND grows louder, intolerable. Brown smoking foliag rains down. EVERYONE looks up.
(KLYTUS, VOICE, ZARKOV)

The topless forest of Arboria is withering, falling apart TREE MEN cry with primal fear as the SEE the sky revealed Hovering against the sun are the dark shapes of MING'S RO SHIPS. PULSING RAYS emanate from projectors on their bott A VOICE booms from heave:
Prisoners of Ming, you are surrounded! The creature who moves is obliterated! EVERYONE stands frozen.
Howls in terror, makes a break for cover. A RAY instantly zaps down at him and he EXPLODES into fiery fragments.

head_text.subj: BACK TO MAIN PART OF FOREST

text: A small SHUTTLE CRAFT descends vertically to a soft landi KLYTUS gets out. Every sound ceases. He nods at BARIN, at ZARKOV. Looks around. Frowns. He walks directly across FLASH'S SHADOW, to ZARKOV.
We'll find vultan later. Where's Flash Gordon?
His Hawkman dropped him. He's dead.
(AURA, DALE)
Nooo -- it's not true!
It is -- they saw him fall a mile into the glaciers of Frigia. DALE shuts her eyes, sobs out:
Oh Flash -- no -- you can't be dead -- it doesn't make any sense --
When I think of being given to Klytus, I wish it was myself who had fallen.
(blazing at her) I don't believe you. You -- you awful Mongo person -- you were born without a heart:
Then what is it that melts into my eyes, Dale Arden? Feel it breaking -- Tear runs down AURA'S cheeks. She seizes DALE'S hand, pre it against her wonderful breast. DALE is really moved.
You poor kid -- don't you have a MOM to talk to?
Ming tired of her. He blew my Mother into outer space. I look into the night sky sometimes and wonder what star she's orbiting --

God, Aura -- no wonder you've had problems -- that bastard: DALE embraces AURA. They cling to each other, bosom again bosom, in perfect womanly understanding. Golden CHORDS ar heard. Doors open. AMAZONS enter.

Capsule sits in its launch-gantry, amidst the ruined blig left by the ray attack. There is not a soul in sight. The Flash's SHADOW moves quickly over the ground toward the Capsule and VANISHES into the hatch. The door shuts itsel 70.

Control levers move. A red button depresses itself. Throu the side, which we should remember is transparent from wi we SEE the scene outside going into a GREEN-BROWN BLUR as the capsule starts to spin for takeoff.
(KLYTUS, MING)
MING is being robed by TWO GIRL ATTENDANTS. Suddenly KLYT is there in a shadow, smiling. MING senses him, turns.
Well? What is it this time?
I can't remember. I feel danger -- but I cannot see it.
Klytus, you're impossible. Aura deserves you.
I foresee another thing. In one minute exactly, the Earthling space capsule will be seen on the scanner. KLYTUS is swallowed again in shadow.
Sailing over the ever frozen Moon of FRIGIA
(CAPTIN, MING)
Capsule is SEEN on the viewing screen, grid-lines dancing over the image as FRIGORIA is left behind. Watching are M KLYTUS, the CAPTAIN and several other SOLDIERS.
Shall I disintegrate it, Your Majesty?
No, Captain -- bring it in. Land it to a warm reception.
Through the front we see MING'S CITY dead ahead and below Numbers flash on the navigation display, constantly chang 71. INVISIBLE HAND picks up a microphone, holds it before INVISIBLE LIPS.
Vultan! Do you read me?
(FLASH'S VOICE, VULTAN)
VULTAN and some other HAWKMEN perch, listening to VOICE c from a radio in VULTAN'S belt.
Flash Gordon calling Vultan! Over! VULTAN doesn't stir a feather. After a moment:
Okay, don't answer -- I'm on Hawkman frequency I know you are reading me. Now get this --

I'm being guided through the force- field under their control. You're on the beam when you've got the tops of two towers lined up exactly -- the high gold one behind the green one with the blue flag got that?
Okay, Vultan, it's your decision the ball is in your court -- I hope I'll be seeing you, you crazy ole bird. The microphone hangs itself up on the panel.
Just sit there, grim-faced. VULTAN shake his head.
He calls us crazy --
(GUARD CAPTAIN, KLYTUS)

It's an armed camp. SOLDIERS stand admits tanks and ray-g artillery, every weapon trained on a landing pad in the middle. 72. KLYTUS waits with his CAPTAIN watching the mirror-bright capsule coming down. It lands. CAPTAIN gives a signal. ZAP! From a tank's ray gun. The capsule's door is knocked with surgical precision off its hinges. Flanked by SOLDIERS with ray-guns at the read the CAPTAIN advances and looks in. He turns and calls bac to KLYTUS in surprise.
It's empty!
What?
Unmanned. Must've taken off on some automatic program. KLYTUS frowns. He doesn't notice the SHADOW that suddenly passes over him, moves on quickly.
Destroy it.
Halts, shift shape as FLASH stops in dismay at that, turn A RAY GUN - ON A TANK ZAPS out a ray. ZARKOV'S CAPSULE - glows white, falls into thin ashes.
Lets out a bitter sigh. Then the SHADOW moves again, fast to an open doorway.
(FLASH' S VOICE, SOLDIER)
Stands on guard. Suddenly out of nowhere, but very close.
Which way to the dungeons, Soldier:
Third elevator down, turn left! (then doing a take) Who is that? 73. WHAM! A left to the gut doubles him over to take an invis knockout right on the chin.

TWO SOLDIERS stand with ray-guns before a heavy locked do Suddenly INVISIBLE FLASH steps behind a flaring torch, ca an enormous SHADOW on the wall. He manipulates his caped arms so that the image becomes truly fearsome.
I am the ghost of all the good men murdered by Ming! Prepare for doom! The SOLDIERS faint.

FOUR SOLDIERS march along, two by two, filling the narrow way. SOUND OF RUNNING FEET coming towards them. They halt i n consternation. WHAM! Invisible FLASH crashes into the sending them flying like bowling-pins.
FOUR GUARDS lounge. around. MOVE to one of them, who sits studying the pictures in the Mingo version of PLAYBOY magazine. A SHADOW falls over the page.
I'm looking at it now -- wait for your turn. An INVISIBLE UPPERCUT knocks him off his chair.
As INVISIBLE FLASH goes after the other three with a dead chair that seems to SWING itself through the air.
ZARKOV, BARIN and TIGER MAN lie in chains, heads cocked a SOUNDS of the facas outside. THUD of a body falling, brie silence, then sound of a KEY IN THE LOCK. The door opens itself.
It's me! 74.
(BARIN, FLASH'S VOICE, ZARKOV)

The Same one AURA and FLASH fell down originally. Now BAR ZARKOV, TIGER MAN and FLASH are inching their way UP it l mountain climbers doing a rock chimney; in. back-to-back pairs, feet pressed out against the shaft walls. What mak it look even stranger, half of the FLASH-BARIN twosome is INVISIBLE. Low conversation as they pant and struggle up
How do we get down to the plasma level?
Anti-gravity shaft -- I got a guard to show me --
This won't be easy, Flash --
Nothing's easy on Mongo --
(CONTROLLER, GUARD CAPTAIN)
LIZARD MEN SLAVES work like mad, shoveling radioactive fu into the seething mass.
CONTROLLERS are at consoles. Many GUARDS stand around. Everyone watches a big hanging dial. Its needle quivers w each flare-up from the inferno below, inches toward a RED SECTOR.
Faster! -- More fueld!
What's the hurry? CONTROLLER What's the hurry?

He wants to give Dale Arden the final destruction of Earth as a wedding present. CONTROLLERS twist the shock-knobs. Tortured SLAVES howl in agony. Some drop and are thrown i the fiery mass, others redouble their efforts. 75.
The needle quivers upwards. MOVE OFF it to a slot-like wi in back wall. There are EYES behind the glass.
(BARIN, FLASH'S VOICE, TIGER MAN, ZARKOV)
ZARKOV,BARIN and TIGER MAN crouch amidst WHIRRING ventila watching through the window.
How's it look to yoU?
Bad. Plasma's contracting into a critical mass. When that needle hits the red, Earth is finished.
Grrao! I'll charge down at them: ZARKOV and BARIN just look at him. TIGER MAN slumps out o his fighting stance. Low door at the back opens itself and INVISIBLE FLASH com in.
Cavern is sealed tight -- every door locked from the inside --
Hope drains from his expression.
Let's face it, my friends -- without a miracle, we've lost.
(HAWKMAN CAPTAIN, VULTAN)
It is filled with HAWKMEN, flying toward us. VULTAN and HIS CAPTAIN. fly in the lead, looking ahead an down at the City of Mingo.
All right -- I see the towers lined up now as Flash Gordon said -- VULTAN soars up and hovers, shouts to the ranks behind: 76.
Through the force-field, my Hawkmen! The pass is narrow -- dive three-by- three! Any man who wishes to turn back may do so!
Keep flying right on, not one bird of them turning back.
Musing to his captain:
Who are these Earthlings, that so many would die for?
They must have one hell of a little
THREE HAWKMEN are SEEN in steep descent. comes ,INTO FOCU over them. PULL BACK. Several OFFICERS and SOLDIERS are around a con watching the screen and other displays.
In range. Another OFFICER touches a red firing-button.
Ranged here are devices like multiple rocket-launchers, bristling with hundreds of arrows. SWOOSH: One fires its load into the sky.
(HAWKMAN CAPTAIN, VULTAN)
The THREE LEADING HAWKMEN are impaled a dozen times each crumple and plummet down. VULTAN and CAPTAIN - HOVERING
It's a trap! The passage is covered! 77.
Onward, Hawkmen! Dive! We outnumber their arrows -- overwhelm them!

INTERCUTS - HAWKMEN and ARROW PROJECTORS as the brave HAWKMEN dive in a converging stream at the invisible opening, and the projectors FIRE again and agai Great slaughter is wreaked on the HAWKMEN, but they keep coming. One group VEERS to the side away from the deadly fire, on to crash into the equally deadly force-field. They EXPLOD into flames.
FIRING OFFICER is almost breaking his thumb, he has it ja down so hard on the red button. ANGLE to the VIEWING SCREEN. On it VULTAN leads a stream descending HAWKMEN.
